lg.l: Occasion'ly as we discours'd of Queen, & Church, & Nation,
Occasion'ly we took in view that Engin, call'd Occasion.
Occasion fram'd for nothing, els but to occasion mischief,
A Cloak to cover Hypocrites, of whom the Devil is Chiefe.
Occasion for a Loop-hole Serve's when ever there's occasion
To leave Plain Dealing in the Lurch, & fly to dear Evasion.
The Loyo overalist may hang himself, and damn's overet Equivocation,
That fusty Ware's now throw'n aside, Occasion's all yẹ fashion.
Let England prize her Native Wares, & not be for Out-Comers,
W'·ave home-spun Jesuits of our own more fine yṇ from Sṭ Omers.
These Saints of fresher Date devis'd this new Trick Call'd Occasion,
By this they have refin'd upon all formall Reformation.
Dull martyrs spilt their Blood in vain for want of this Devise, Sir,
By this they might have Heathens been, & Christians in a trice, Sir.
Occasion more Faces has upon Occasion Surely
Than ever Hough or Burgess had, who taught the Gospell purely.
True Scot upon Occasion can look like an English Bishop,
And Quack out-doe's with Whiggish Wares all Such as come to his Shop.
Occasion can make a man with little or no trouble
Sincere as Canting Whitaker, or honest as Tom Double.
Occasion permit's the Saints occasionly to lye, Sir,
And fathom mysteries too deep for either You or J, Sir,
Occasionly they shall conform, occasionly dissent, Sir,
Occasionly shall take an Oath to break it with Jntent, Sir.
Occasionly shall go to Church, occasionly to Meeting,
Occasionly betray their Lord while they like Judas greet him.
Occasionly deny him too in open view of men, Sir,
And where's the harm? for when 'tis fit, they own him can agen, Sir.
Occasionly Communicate, occasionly refrain, Sir,
But constantly Communicate when 'twill Occasion gain, Sir,
When 'twill Occasion Godly men to Parliament to ride-a,
And they with Great Sincerity to take Occasion's Side-a.
When 'twill Occasions Cheats to 'Scape, & hinder fair accompting,
When 'twill Occasion Lets and Rubs past Honesty's Surmounting.
On such occasion they can Kneell like rankest Jdolaters,
But Turn once serv'd, and Place obtain'd, no stiffer Jdol-haters.
Thus 'Casion'ly for God they are, & 'Casion'ly for Devil,
Occasionly for Good again, occasionly for Evill.
Occasionly for Heav'n bound, Occasionly for Hell, Sṛ,
